message:
start of arduino pin editor

the system will autodetect if you are using a usb device or accessory and setup config accordingly.
once you enter the setup menu, you are shown a picture of the device, you click on the pins and an editor shows up allowing you to configure that bank of pins.
also incldued is improvments to the arduino service, and including the ftdi drivers needed

title: home screen customization now works fully.  It will surely get cleaned up and…
message:
home screen customization now works fully.  It will surely get cleaned up and features added and such, but it works.  You can add/edit/remove all buttons, with an undefined limit of screens (I haven't tried to hit the limit... but really, 100 screens, come on).
Deleting a screen deletes all buttons associated with said screen and reorganizes all the upper screens to be down one spot.

Signed-off-by: Eric Friesen <efriesen@gmail.com>

title: big one.  from the settings menu you can now add/edit/remove all buttons from…
message:
big one.  from the settings menu you can now add/edit/remove all buttons from the home screen (currently limited to one. more will come soon).
each button you can change the icon, pulls from a specified list.  the text to whatever you want. and the action.  The actions are pulled from the available "buttons" specified.  The buttons programmed will always to the same task.

Signed-off-by: Eric Friesen <efriesen@gmail.com>

title: more playlist improvements

more playlist improvements

removed the "playlist manager" and replaced it with an alert dialog, it looks a lot better and more androidish.  this altered some of the method callbacks i need/don't need, so the old ones have been removed from the base class.
also the playlist is more user friendly for adding/updating.  it's one method, and if there is a valid id, it does an update, if not, it will create a new list

title: fix fragment overlaying itself
message:
fix fragment overlaying itself

fix fragment overlaying itself.  on boot, and orientation change, the fragments would overlay themselves.  i was adding them multiple times instead of checking their presence and replacing them.  once that was fixed then portions wouldn't maintain state, so setretaininstace was set to true in a bunch of fragments.

title: rfid and the alarm now work pretty well.  you can add tags using the rfid…
message:
rfid and the alarm now work pretty well.  you can add tags using the rfid reader.  the droid will store them in a db, and then pass the info to the mcu to store in eeprom.  when you remove the tag it nullifies the eeprom.  there is also some flags being stored, for things like enabled, can open doors, and can start car.  they still need some work on the arduino side, but the android side is working properly

Signed-off-by: Eric Friesen <efriesen@gmail.com>

title: huge overhaul of fragment management.  replaced statically added xml with…
message:
huge overhaul of fragment management.  replaced statically added xml with programatically done in code.  
This allows for easier addition of other fragments and sub-activities.  It also allows for easy animation, which has also been added.
I don't know why I didn't do this before.

Signed-off-by: Eric Friesen <efriesen@gmail.com>
